criteria: Understanding the Impact of Emotional Expression
descriptions: Student struggles to identify basic emotions in themselves and others.
Student can identify basic emotions (e.g., happiness, sadness, anger) in themselves and others with prompting.
Student can identify basic emotions in themselves and others, but may struggle with more complex emotions or nuanced expressions.
Student can accurately identify a range of emotions in themselves and others, including complex emotions like frustration or disappointment.
Student demonstrates a strong ability to recognize and understand a wide range of emotions in themselves and others, including subtle cues and non-verbal communication.

Student exhibits exceptional emotional awareness, demonstrating a deep understanding of their own emotions and the emotions of others, including the ability to interpret complex emotional expressions and contextual factors.
Student expresses emotions in ways that are consistently inappropriate or harmful to themselves or others.
Student sometimes expresses emotions inappropriately, such as through aggression or withdrawal, but can be redirected with guidance.
Student generally expresses emotions in an appropriate manner, but may occasionally struggle in challenging situations or when experiencing intense emotions.
Student consistently expresses emotions in ways that are respectful and considerate of others, even in challenging situations.
Student demonstrates a high level of emotional regulation, expressing emotions in a way that is both authentic and appropriate for the context, showing sensitivity to the feelings of others.
Student excels at expressing emotions in a way that promotes healthy communication, empathy, and positive relationships, serving as a role model for others in managing their emotions effectively.
Student is unaware of the impact their emotional expressions have on others.
Student shows limited awareness of how their emotional expressions affect those around them.
Student recognizes that their emotions can impact others, but may struggle to anticipate the consequences of their actions.
Student understands how their emotional expressions affect others and can generally adjust their behavior accordingly.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of the impact of their emotional expressions on others, adapting their behavior to promote positive interactions and avoid causing harm.

Student exhibits exceptional emotional intelligence, skillfully managing their own emotions and understanding the impact of their expressions on others, fostering empathy, and creating supportive relationships.
